intro: Exochaenium mechowianum, commonly known as the Mechowian grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the central Asian region. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
